meanings.definition: To extract or obtain something from a source
meanings.sent1: She tried to estreat information from the old books.
meanings.sent2: The miners estreat precious gems from the deep caves.
meanings.sent3: The detective estreated the truth from the suspect with clever questions.
meanings.sent4: Like a skilled chef, she estreated flavors from the fresh ingredients.
meanings.sent5: The magician estreated a rabbit from the empty hat, amazing the audience.

meanings.definition: A legal document or record showing a fine or penalty
meanings.sent1: He kept the estreat of the parking ticket in his file.
meanings.sent2: The court clerk filed the estreat in the official records.
meanings.sent3: The ancient scroll contained an estreat of the royal decree.
meanings.sent4: The museum displayed an estreat of the historical tax law.
meanings.sent5: The lawyer presented the estreat as evidence in the case.

meanings.definition: To enforce or carry out a law or regulation
meanings.sent1: The police officer must estreat traffic laws to ensure safety.
meanings.sent2: It is important to estreat rules to maintain order in society.
meanings.sent3: The teacher estreated the classroom rules with a friendly reminder.
meanings.sent4: The coach estreated discipline among the team members.
meanings.sent5: The judge will estreat the court order to protect the rights of the citizens.
